The Collector um the open tempure
collector is a like basically an agent
or a an observability pipeline
middleware however you want to describe

your Telemetry pipeline somewhere um
sometimes toward the start but um
generally toward the middle um it helps

your observability back end um whether
that's your applications your
infrastructure um it can handle the job
and uh one thing to note The Collector
doesn't store this data it's going to
forward it onto a backend somewhere else
um so inside of the collector uh what
you have are a number of components so
everything's assembled using Pipelines
so it flows through the collector and
you can configure how the data flows
through um so you have basically maximum
flexibility so it comes in through
components called receivers so these
will take an input data format whether
that's Cy log um elastic search um some
kind of metrics on your host OTL you
name it um and then it puts it into the
pipeline where you can do any number of
processing operations on it so this
might just be tweaking some Fields you
might want to do some redaction some
sampling Etc uh and then finally you put
it into an exporter and the exporters
will translate it into an output format
we hope uh OTP works for you but um any
other output formats or any number of
other output formats are sgg are
supported um and so there in addition to
these sets of components um there's a
handful of others of The Collector
supports so all of the collectors data

into these different types of components
they all fulfill a particular function
inside of the collector um and they're
all available each as their own modules

The Collector Builder The Collector
Builder basically is supposed to

files that import these components and

those API uh code templates and generate

code on the spot but what you'll do is
you will take a go binary that should be

to be bundled in with OCB and that will
